intro: Diplusodon uninervius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed diplusodon, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
